subject: Philosophy
title: The Virtues Across Cultures
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Virtues Across Cultures usable.

hook.text: Aristotle valued courage. Confucius valued filial piety. The Buddha valued compassion.

buildup.text: Different cultures emphasize different virtues, yet remarkable overlaps appear.

discovery.text: Honesty, justice, courage, and kindness show up in nearly every moral tradition on Earth.

twist.text: But priorities differ. Western ethics prizes autonomy. East Asian ethics prizes harmony and duty.

climax.text: The universal core suggests something shared in human nature. The variation reflects cultural needs.

quiz.question: Which virtues appear across most cultures?
